sub_topic: Solving non-homogeneous systems of linear equations
message_1:
Solve the following non-homogeneous system of linear equations for x, y, and z: 

3x + 2y - z = 7 

x + 4y + 2z = 4 

2x - 3y + 5z = -1
message_2:
To solve the non-homogeneous system of linear equations, we can use the method of substitution, elimination, or matrices. In this case, we will use the method of matrices.

First, we write the given system of equations in matrix form AX = B, where A is the matrix of coefficients, X is the column matrix of variables (x, y, z), and B is the column matrix of constants.

A = | 3  2 -1 |
    | 1  4  2 |
    | 2 -3  5 |

X = | x |
    | y |
    | z |

B = |  7  |
    |  4  |
    | -1  |

Now, we will find the inverse of matrix A (A^(-1)) and then multiply it by matrix B to get the solution matrix X.

To find the inverse of matrix A, we first find the determinant of A.

det(A) = 3(4*5 - 2*(-3)) - 2(1*5 - 2*(-3)) + (-1)(1*(-3) - 2*4)
       = 3(20 + 6) - 2(5 + 6) - (-1)(-3 - 8)
       = 3(26) - 2(11) + 11
       = 78 - 22 + 11
       = 67

Since the determinant is non-zero, the inverse of matrix A exists. Now, we find the adjugate of matrix A and then divide it by the determinant to get the inverse.

adj(A) = |  (4*5 - 2*(-3))  -(1*5 - 2*(-3))   (1*(-3) - 2*4)  |
         | -(2*5 - 5*(-3))   (3*5 - 5*(-1))  -(3*(-3) - 2*2)  |
         |  (2*4 - 4*2)     -(3*4 - 1*2)      (3*1 - 1*2)     |

adj(A) = |  26   11  -11 |
         | -19   20   7  |
         |   0   -10  1  |

Now, we find A^(-1) by dividing adj(A) by det(A).

A^(-1) = (1/det(A)) * adj(A)

A^(-1) = (1/67) * |  26   11  -11 |
                 | -19   20   7  |
                 |   0   -10  1  |

Now, we multiply A^(-1) by B to get the solution matrix X.

X = A^(-1) * B

X = (1/67) * |  26   11  -11 |  |  7  |
             | -19   20   7  |  |  4  |
             |   0   -10  1  |  | -1  |

X = | (26*7 + 11*4 - 11*(-1))/67 |
    | (-19*7 + 20*4 + 7*(-1))/67  |
    | (0*7 - 10*4 + 1*(-1))/67    |

X = | (182 + 44 + 11)/67 |
    | (-133 + 80 - 7)/67  |
    | (-40 - 1)/67       |

X = | 237/67 |
    | -60/67  |
    | -41/67  |

X = |  x  |
    |  y  |
    |  z  |

So, the solution to the given system of linear equations is:

x = 237/67 = 3
y = -60/67
z = -41/67
